Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Neoadjuvant Targeted Therapy in EGFR-Mutant Resectable Lung Adenocarcinoma

Participants.evidence: 24 patients with stage IIA-IIIB EGFR-mutant lung adenocarcinoma

Intervention.evidence: treated with neoadjuvant targeted therapy followed by surgery

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the objective response rate (ORR) post-treatment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 24 patients with stage IIA-IIIB EGFR-mutant lung adenocarcinoma treated with neoadjuvant targeted therapy followed by surgery from July 2019 to October 2024.

Number_Analysed.evidence: All 24 patients achieved successful R0 resection.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The ORR was 83.3% (20/24), and the MPR was 37.5% (9/24), with 2 patients achieving pathological complete response (pCR).

Harms.evidence: 54.2% (13/24) experienced grade 1-2 adverse events, with no grade 3 or higher events reported.
